page.title: 06HISTORY OF CRANHAM
page.content: Cranham was originally a{Saxon village.In the 1086{Domesday Book}we are told that Aelfric held the mannor before 1066 and then Hugh took over. There were 8 villagers,15 smallholders 4 slaves.The value of Cranham was Â£6. The most famous man to live here was {James Oglethorpe}founder of the state of Georgia,who lived at{Cranham Hall in the 18th Century. Until the coming of the railway in the 1870s Upminster was a very small village.Since then its growth has been rapid into a very large commuter town embracing the village of Cranham. The places of historic interest in the area are the{windmill}which was built in 1802 and the{tithe barn}which was built in 1450.
